text: Robert William Hoskins (26 October 1942 – 29 April 2014) was a British actor. He was born in Bury St Edmunds, Suffolk and raised in Finsbury Park, London. Hoskins' movies include: The Long Good Friday, Mona Lisa and Who Framed Roger Rabbit. He won a BAFTA Award and a Golden Globe Award for his role as George in Mona Lisa. He was also awarded a doctorate degree (degree in acting) at the graduation ceremony of Royal Central School of Speech and Drama in London, England. On 8 August 2012, Hoskins said he had retired, having being diagnosed with Parkinson's disease in late 2011.Bob Hoskins to retire after Parkinson's diagnosis He died of pneumonia on the morning of 29
